intro: Malvastrum stenopetalum, commonly known as the narrow-petaled mallows, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its showy, pentagonal flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in full sun, displaying vibrant pink to purple blooms. Its foliage consists of heart-shaped, woolly leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Malvastrum stenopetalum is a perennial shrub that is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance.
